Element.Description: Identifies the earliest version of the UBL 2 schema for this document type that defines all of the elements that might be encountered in the current instance.

Element.Name: Specification identification
Element.Description: An identification of the specification containing the total set of rules regarding semantic content, cardinalities and business rules to which the data contained in the instance document conforms.

Element.Name: Business process type identifier
Element.Description: Identifies the business process context in which the transaction appears. It enables the buyer to process the document in an appropriate way.

Element.Name: Pre-award catalogue request identifier
Element.Description: The identifier that enables referencing of the document instance for various purposes including referencing between transactions that are part of the same process.

Element.Name: Catalogue issue date
Element.Description: The date on which the catalogue request instance was issued.

Element.Name: The time on which the pre-award catalogue request was issued.
Catalogue version
Element.Description: The version ID of a catalogue.

Element.Name: Pre award catalogue request validity period
Element.Description: The validity period must include both start date and end date, and the start date must be earlier than the end date

Element.Name: Period start date
Element.Description: The date when the period starts.

Element.Name: Period end date
Element.Description: The date on which the period ends.

Element.Name: Call for Tenders reference
Element.Description: A reference to a Call for Tenders that can be identified.

Element.Name: Call for tenders reference identifier
Element.Description: A reference to the call for tender as issued by the contracting body.

Element.Name: Previously requested catalogue reference
Element.Description: A reference to a specific Catalogue request; used if the Catalogue Request is updated.

Element.Name: Previous catalogue request identifier
Element.Description: The catalogue request identifier for the updated catalogue request

Element.Name: Previous version identifier
Element.Description: The previous version of the catalogue request that is superseded by this version.

Element.Name: Catalogue request provider party
Element.Description: The contracting authority or contracting entity who is sending the catalogue request and buying supplies, services or public works using a tendering procedure, using a catalogue request, as described in the applicable directive.

Element.Name: Catalogue provider electronic address identifier
Element.Description: The electronic address of the party that sends the catalogue request.

Attribute.Description: The identification of the identification scheme.

Element.Name: Catalogue provider standard identifier
Element.Description: The standard identifier of the party that sends the catalogue request.

Attribute.Name: Identification Scheme. Identifier
Attribute.Description: Scheme id mandatory use "ZZZ" for unidentified scheme. The identification of the identification scheme.

Element.Name: Catalogue provider name
Element.Description: The name of the party that sends the catalogue request. Use in absence of, or in addition to party identifier

Element.Name: Address line 1
Element.Description: The main address line in an address.

Element.Name: Address line 2
Element.Description: An additional address line in an address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line.

Element.Name: City
Element.Description: The common name of a city where the address is located.

Element.Name: Post code
Element.Description: The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant postal service, such as a ZIP code or Post Code.

Element.Name: Country subdivision
Element.Description: The subdivision of a country such as region, county, state, province etc.

Element.Name: Country code
Element.Description: A code that identifies the country.

Attribute.Description: The identification of a list of codes.

Element.Name: Contact point
Element.Description: The name of the contact point.

Element.Name: Contact telephone number
Element.Description: A phone number for the contact point.

Element.Name: Contact fax number
Element.Description: A fax number for the contact point.

Element.Name: Contact email address
Element.Description: An e-mail address for the contact point.

Element.Name: Catalogue Request receiver party
Element.Description: The party to which the catalogue request is sent. Any natural or legal person or public entity or group of such persons and/or entities, including any temporary association of undertakings, which offers the execution of works and/or a work, the supply of products or the provision of services on the market.

Element.Name: Catalogue receiver electronic address identifier
Element.Description: The electronic address of the party to which the catalogue request is sent.

Attribute.Description: The identification of the identification scheme.

Element.Name: Catalogue receiver standard identifier
Element.Description: The standard identifier of the party to which the catalogue request is sent.

Attribute.Name: Identification Scheme. Identifier
Attribute.Description: Scheme id mandatory use "ZZZ" for unidentified scheme. The identification of the identification scheme.

Element.Name: Catalogue receiver name
Element.Description: The name of the party to which the catalogue request is sent.

Element.Name: Address line 1
Element.Description: The main address line in an address.

Element.Name: Address line 2
Element.Description: An additional address line in an address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line.

Element.Name: City
Element.Description: The common name of a city where the address is located.

Element.Name: Post code
Element.Description: The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant postal service, such as a ZIP code or Post Code.

Element.Name: Country subdivision
Element.Description: The subdivision of a country such as region, county, state, province etc.

Element.Name: Country code
Element.Description: A code that identifies the country.

Attribute.Description: The identification of a list of codes.

Element.Name: Supplier contact
Element.Description: Catalogue supplier contact

Element.Name: Contact point
Element.Description: The name of the contact point.

Element.Name: Contact telephone number
Element.Description: A phone number for the contact point.

Element.Name: Contact fax number
Element.Description: A fax number for the contact point.

Element.Name: Contact email address
Element.Description: An e-mail address for the contact point.

Element.Name: Pre award catalogue request line
Element.Description: A line in a pre-award catalogue request specifying detailed information of an item, price and its composition.

Element.Name: Pre award catalogue request line identifier
Element.Description: Each line must have an identifier that is unique within the document to make it possible to reference the line. For example, from other documents.

Element.Name: Line validity period
Element.Description: The requested delivery period for this item request. If used, both start and end date must be present.

Element.Name: Period start date
Element.Description: The date is the first day of the period.

Element.Name: Period end date
Element.Description: The date is the last day of the period.

Element.Name: Item Location Quantity
Element.Description: Properties of the item in this catalogue line that are dependent on location and quantity.

Element.Name: Minimum quantity
Element.Description: The minimum quantity for this item request/location. To specify an exact quantity, use the same quantity in both minimum and maximum quantity.

Attribute.Name: Quantity unit code
Attribute.Description: The unit of the quantity. Codes for unit of packaging from UNECE Recommendation No. 21 can be used in accordance with the descriptions in the "Intro" section of UN/ECE Recommendation 20, Revision 11 (2015): The 2 character alphanumeric code values in UNECE Recommendation 21 shall be used. To avoid duplication with existing code values in UNECE Recommendation No. 20, each code value from UNECE Recommendation 21 shall be prefixed with an “X”, resulting in a 3 alphanumeric code when used as a unit of measure.

Element.Name: Delivery location
Element.Description: This element is used if there are specific locations requested for the item.

Element.Name: Address line 1
Element.Description: Usually the street name and number or post office box.

Element.Name: Country code
Element.Description: The lists of valid countries are registered with the ISO 3166-1 Maintenance agency, "Codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions". It is recommended to use the alpha-2 representation.

Element.Name: Price
Element.Description: To state both the minimum price and the total budget price (maximum price), repeat the requested item location quantity for each type

Element.Name: Item net price
Element.Description: The net price has to be equal with the gross price less the item price discount. The price for the item at the specified locations.

Element.Name: Item price type
Element.Description: The type of the price so that the receiver knows if the price may be changed is indicative. When prices are temporary the validity period for the price should be defined by stating the price validity period.

Element.Name: Period start date
Element.Description: The date is the first day of the period.

Element.Name: Period end date
Element.Description: The date is the last day of the period.

Element.Name: Pre award catalogue request item details
Item request description
Element.Description: A description of the item request specifying the kind of item that is requested.
Element.Value: John Eddison needs a samsung computer.

Element.Name: Item request name
Element.Description: A name for the item request, e.g., the kind of item that is requested.

Element.Name: Item key words
Element.Description: Used to specify searchable keywords and/or synonyms for the item.

Element.Name: Item standard identifier
Element.Description: The standard identifier of the catalogue request item

Element.Name: Item classification code
Element.Description: A code for classifying the item by its type or nature. Classification codes are used to allow grouping of similar items for a various purposes e.g. public procurement (CPV), e-Commerce (UNSPSC) etc.

Element.Name: Attached item request specifications
Element.Description: Attachments can be sent on line level in the Catalogue request. This can be images or additional descriptions of the product request. It is strongly recommended to use external references in the form of URI’s for attachments.

Element.Name: Attachment identifier
Element.Description: An identifier that can be used to reference the attached document, such as a unique identifier

Element.Name: Attachment description code
Element.Description: A functional description of the attachment, expressed as a code

Element.Name: Document type
Element.Description: A functional description of the attachment

Element.Name: Attachment description
Element.Description: A short description of the attached document

Element.Name: Attached document
Element.Description: A binary large object containing an attached document. Base 64 encoded

Attribute.Description: Mime type of the attached document

Element.Name: External item specification URI
Element.Description: URI reference to external item information or specifications. E.g. web address

Element.Name: Item origin country
Element.Description: The code identifying from which country the requested product should originate.

Element.Name: Item classification code
Element.Description: A code for classifying the item by its type or nature. Classification codes are used to allow grouping of similar items for a various purposes e.g. public procurement (CPV), e-Commerce (UNSPSC) etc.

Element.Name: Classified tax category
Element.Description: VAT information

Element.Name: Item VAT category code
Element.Description: The VAT category for the item

Element.Name: Item VAT rate
Element.Description: The VAT rate, represented as percentage that applies to the item. A VAT rate of zero percent is applied for calculation purposes even if the item is outside the scope of VAT. Unless specific trade reasons apply such as exemptions.

Element.Name: Additional item property
Element.Description: Additional properties are meant for product properties that cannot be sent in any of the defined elements in the Catalogue request. Additional properties consist of the Name of the property and the actual Value.

Element.Name: Item property identifier
Element.Description: A property identifier for the property of the item request.

Element.Name: Item property name
Element.Description: The name of the requested property.The name must be sufficiently descriptive to define the value. The definition may be supplemented with the property unit of measure when relevant.

Element.Name: Item property classification code
Element.Description: Code for the requested item property according to a property code system

Element.Name: Item property value
Element.Description: The value of the requested item property

Element.Name: Item property unit of measure
Element.Description: The unit of measure in which the requested property value is stated, if relevant. May not be relevant when properties are descriptive.

Element.Name: Item property unit of measure
Element.Description: The quantity of the requested item property.

Attribute.Name: Quantity unit code
Attribute.Description: The unit of the quantity. Codes for unit of packaging from UNECE Recommendation No. 21 can be used in accordance with the descriptions in the "Intro" section of UN/ECE Recommendation 20, Revision 11 (2015): The 2 character alphanumeric code values in UNECE Recommendation 21 shall be used. To avoid duplication with existing code values in UNECE Recommendation No. 20, each code value from UNECE Recommendation 21 shall be prefixed with an “X”, resulting in a 3 alphanumeric code when used as a unit of measure.

Element.Name: Item property unit of measure
Element.Description: Relevance of the requested property in the corresponding pre-award catalogue request.

Element.Name: Item property range
Element.Description: Applicable range for the values of the requested property.

Element.Name: Requested item property minimum value
Element.Description: The minimum value requested for this property.

Element.Name: Requested item property maximum value
Element.Description: The maximum value requested for this property.

Element.Name: Item label type
Element.Description: The label type such environmental, quality, social etc.

Element.Name: Item label name
Element.Description: The name of the product label

Element.Name: Item label value
Element.Description: The label value that applies to the item.

Element.Name: Item label issuer party name
Element.Description: Name of the party issuing the item label.

Element.Name: Item label reference
Element.Description: A reference to where the label specification can be found, e.g. a URI.

Element.Name: Call for Tenders line reference
Element.Description: Reference to a Line on a Call For Tenders document.

Element.Name: Requested deliverable identifier
Element.Description: Identifier for a requested deliverable.
